ques.text: Know about yourself and what your friends think about you. :
ques.text2: <name> wants to know what do you think about <name>. Ask for name. Start button

ques.placeholder: to come back and see result.

questions.text: In a difficult situation, do you
questions.text2: In a difficult situation, how does <name> decides

questions.text: To take decisions, do you need
How do you think in difficult situation?
questions.text2: How does <name> think in difficult situation?

ISTJ.text: <name> is responsible organizers, driven to create and enforce order within systems and institutions. <name> is neat and orderly, inside and out, and tend to have a procedure for everything <name> do. Reliable and dutiful, <name> want to uphold tradition and follow regulations.

ISFJ.text: <name> is conventional and grounded, and enjoy contributing to established structures of society. <name> is steady and committed workers with a deep sense of responsibility to others. <name> focus on fulflling their duties, particularly when taking care of the needs of other people. <name> want others to know that <name> is reliable and can be trusted to do what is expected. <name> is conscientious and methodical, and persist until the job is done.

INFJ.text: <name> has a unique ability to intuit others' emotions and motivations, and will often know how someone else is feeling before that person knows it himself. <name> trust insights about others and have strong faith in ability to read people. Although <name> is sensitive, <name> is also reserved; <name> is a private sort, and is selective about sharing intimate thoughts and feelings.

INTJ.text: <name> approach life by analyzing the theory behind what they see, and are typically focused inward, on own thoughtful study of the world around them. <name> is drawn to logical systems and is much less comfortable with the unpredictable nature of other people and their emotions. <name> is typically independent and selective about relationships, preferring to associate with people who <name> finds intellectually stimulating.

ISTP.text: <name> is observant artisans with an understanding of mechanics and an interest in troubleshooting. <name> approach environments with a flexible logic, looking for practical solutions to the problems at hand. <name> is independent and adaptable, and typically interact with the world around them in a self-directed, spontaneous manner. <name> is reserved, but not withdrawn: enjoys taking action, and approaches the world with a keen appreciation for the physical and sensory experiences it has to ofer.

ISFP.text: <name> is gentle caretakers who live in the present moment and enjoy their surroundings with cheerful, low-key enthusiasm. <name> is flexible and spontaneous, and like to go with the flow to enjoy what life has to offer. <name> is quiet and unassuming, and may be hard to get to know. However, to those who know them well, <name> is warm and friendly, eager to share in life's many experiences.

INFP.text: <name> is sensitive, caring, and compassionate, and and is deeply concerned with the personal growth of themselves and others. Individualistic and nonjudgmental, <name> believe that each person must find their own path. <name> enjoy's spending time exploring <name>'s own ideas and values, and is gently encouraging to others to do the same. <name> is creative and often artistic; <name> enjoy finding new outlets for self-expression.

INTP.text: <name> is philosophical innovators, fascinated by logical analysis, systems, and design. <name> is preoccupied with theory, and search for the universal law behind everything they see. <name> want to understand the unifying themes of life, in all complexity.

ESTP.text: Active and playful, <name> is often the life of the party and have a good sense of humor. <name> use keen powers of observation to assess audience and adapt textly to keep interactions exciting. Although <name> typically appear very social, they is rarely sensitive; <name> prefers to keep things fast-paced and silly rather than emotional or serious.

ESFP.text: <name> is vivacious entertainers who charm and engage those around them. <name> is spontaneous, energetic, and fun-loving, and take pleasure in the things around them: food, clothes, nature, animals, and especially people. <name> is typically warm and talkative and have a contagious enthusiasm for life. <name> like to be in the middle of the action and the center of attention. <name> have a playful, open sense of humor, and like to draw out other people and help them have a good time.

ENFP.text: <name> is people-centered creators with a focus on possibilities and a contagious enthusiasm for new ideas, people and activities .<name> is typically agile and expressive communicators, using wit, humor, and mastery of language to create engaging stories. Imaginative and original, <name> often have a strong artistic side. <name> is drawn to art because of its ability to express inventive ideas and a create a deeper understanding of human experience.

ENTP.text: <name> enjoy playing with ideas and especially like to banter with others. <name> use text wit and command of language to keep the upper hand with other people, often cheerfully poking fun at their habits and eccentricities. While <name> enjoys challenging others, in the end they is usually happy to live and let live. <name> is rarely judgmental, but may have little patience for people who can't keep up.

ESTJ.text: <name> is the consummate organizers, and want to bring structure to surroundings. <name> value predictability and prefer things to proceed in a logical order. When <name> see a lack of organization, <name> often takes the initiative to establish processes and guidelines, so that everyone knows what's expected.

ESFJ.text: <name> value loyalty and tradition, and usually make family and friends top priority. <name> is generous with time, efort, and emotions. <name> often take on the concerns of others as if it were their own, and will attempt to put <name>'s signifcant organizational talents to use to bring order to other people's lives.

ENFJ.text: <name> is typically energetic and driven, and often have a lot on plates. <name> is tuned into the needs of others and acutely aware of human suffering; however, <name> also tend to be optimistic and forward-thinking, intuitively seeing opportunity for improvement. The <name> is ambitious, but ambition is not self-serving: rather, <name> feel personally responsible for making the world a better place.

ENTJ.text: <name> is responsible organizers, driven to create and enforce order within systems and institutions. <name> is neat and orderly, inside and out, and tend to have a procedure for everything they do. Reliable and dutiful, <name> want to uphold tradition and follow regulations.

static.questions-title: There are sixteen personality types and each of us leans toward one of the types. Each personality type has four letters.
